item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A faster way to copy SQLite databases between computers (114 points | 50 comments)
2. The Brief Origins of May Day (43 points | 19 comments)
3. How to vibe code for free: Running Qwen3 on your Mac, using MLX (37 points | 16 comments)
4. Linkwarden: FOSS self-hostable bookmarking with AI-tagging and page archival (21 points | 6 comments)
5. Judge Rules Apple Executive Lied Under Oath, Makes Criminal Contempt Referral (78 points | 9 comments)
6. Trust Me, I'm Local: Chrome Extensions, MCP, and the Sandbox Escape (17 points | 2 comments)
7. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (365 points | 523 comments)
8. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (329 points | 100 comments)
9. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (352 points | 146 comments)
10. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (877 points | 366 comments)
11. Pwning the Ladybird Browser (243 points | 36 comments)
12. Espressif's ESP32-C5 Is Now in Mass Production (210 points | 137 comments)
13. The one interview question that will protect you from North Korean fake workers (84 points | 54 comments)
14. Linux Kernel Exploitation: Attack of the Vsock (212 points | 59 comments)
15. All four major web browsers are about to lose 80% of their funding (443 points | 449 comments)
16. How the US defense secretary circumvents official DoD communications equipment (288 points | 247 comments)
17. Zhaoxin's KX-7000 (162 points | 42 comments)

20. I created Perfect Wiki and reached $250k in annual revenue without investors (655 points | 371 comments)
21. International Workers' Day (10 points | discuss)
22. Home washing machines fail to remove important pathogens from textiles (74 points | 100 comments)
23. I Found Malware in a BeamNG Mod (134 points | 19 comments)
24. Someone at YouTube needs glasses (1262 points | 639 comments)
25. Reversible computing with mechanical links and pivots (150 points | 64 comments)
26. If you're in the market for a $1,900 color E Ink monitor, one of them exists now (4 points | discuss)
27. GroMo (YC W21) Is Hiring ( | hide)
28. NotebookLM Audio Overviews are now available in over 50 languages (295 points | 84 comments)
29. You Wouldn't Download a Hacker News (424 points | 218 comments)
30. The Secret Services' involvement in the making of The Line of Fire (1993) [pdf] (12 points | 6 comments)
